(d. 575) [ Syr. Orth. ] Metropolitan ‘of the East’, known as the Apostle of the Arabs. Originating from Balad , he became first bp. of Beth ʿArbaye , and was subsequently consecrated as Metropolitan of the East by Yaʿqub Burdʿoyo (in 559). He undertook much missionary work, and it was due to his conversion of a son of Khusrau I that he was eventually put to death (2 Aug. 575). An informative biography, by an unknown author, is preserved. Sources J.-M. Fiey, ‘Ahoudemmeh’, LM 81 (1968), 155–9. F.  Nau, Histoires d’Ahoudemmeh et de Marouta ( PO 3.1; 1905), 7–51. (Syr. with FT ) Vööbus, History of Asceticism , vol. 3, 246–54. Sebastian P. Brock
